examples: He opened the door and quickly gave the apartment a once over, confirming that nothing was untoward.

words.defineEn: not expected, normally inconvenient or unpleasant
words.defineVi: không mong đợi, thường bất tiện hoặc khó chịu

words.defineEn: defying expression or description
words.defineVi: bất chấp biểu hiện hoặc mô tả

examples: Our desire to present our own lives as perfect can turn us into unwitting salespeople for every product and service we use.

words.defineEn: not done with purpose or intent

words.defineEn: unaccustomed or unusual
words.defineVi: không quen thuộc hoặc bất thường

examples: After a long day at work, Aurora enjoyed unwinding by sunbathing in her backyard in her birthday suit, soaking up the warm rays.

words.defineEn: an atmospheric phenomenon consisting of bands of light caused by charged solar particles following the earth's magnetic lines of force
words.defineVi: một hiện tượng khí quyển bao gồm các dải ánh sáng gây ra bởi các hạt mặt trời tích điện theo các đường sức từ của trái đất

examples: It accelerates electrons toward Jupiter’s atmosphere and causes additional auroral emissions.
We’ve also observed Enceladus’s auroral footprint on Saturn, so we know that this isn’t something unique to Jupiter.
In fact, these auroral footprints could be found where there’s any electrically-conducting moon orbiting inside a planet’s magnetosphere, or even a planet inside a star’s.
So if STEVE is an auroral event, then scientists should be able to detect these particles when the streak appears.
words.defineEn: characteristic of the dawn
words.defineVi: đặc trưng của bình minh

words.defineEn: assign a name or title to
words.defineVi: gán tên hoặc tiêu đề cho

examples: You can see it in the struggle for legal rights and political power, from Richard Allen, founder of the African Methodist Episcopal Church, the country's first independent Black denomination, to Reverend Martin Luther King Jr. in the 1960s.

words.defineEn: identifying word or words by which someone or something is called and classified or distinguished from others

examples: Common denominator is 6.

words.defineEn: insincerity by virtue of pretending to have qualities or beliefs that you do not really have

examples: He's such a hypocrite!

words.defineEn: someone who pretends to have virtues or beliefs they do not practice, often contradicting their own stated values or engaging in deceptive behavior
words.defineVi: ai đó giả vờ có đức tính hoặc niềm tin mà họ không thực hành, thường mâu thuẫn với các giá trị đã nêu của chính họ hoặc tham gia vào hành vi lừa đảo

examples: Trying to climb on any high horse would only be embarrassing at best, and at the very least hypocritical.

examples: Darwin wanted to wait until he had incontrovertible proof.

examples: The reaction to Jeff's idea to start selling books on the internet was pretty incredulous, you know, from a lot of the people close to him.
